verse: The Human Family. These are the descendants of the sons of Noah: Shem, Ham and Japheth, to whom sons were born after the flood.
The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meschech, and Tiras.
The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim, and the Rodanim.
From these came the peoples of the islands and their territories, each clan in the nations with their own language.
The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca.
Cush gave birth to Nimrod. He was the first of the mighty ones upon the earth.
He was a great hunter before the Lord, for it is said, “Just like Nimrod, a great hunter before the Lord.”
The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, and Accad, all of them in the land of Shinar.
From that land he went to Asshur where he built Nineveh, Rehoboth-ir, Calah,
and Resen between Nineveh and Calah, which is the main city.
Mizraim gave birth to the Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
Pathrusim, Casluhim, and Caphtorim (from whom came the Philistines).
Canaan gave birth to Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth,
and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.
These were the sons of Ham according to their clans and their languages, in their various territories and according to their peoples.
Shem, the ancestor of all of the sons of Eber and the older brother of Japheth, also had children.
The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.
The sons of Aram were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
Arpachshad gave birth to Shelah, and Shelah gave birth to Eber.
Eber had two sons: one named Peleg (for in his days the earth was divided) and the other named Joktan.
Joktan gave birth to Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
They lived in the mountain region in the east, from Mesha on toward Sephar.
These were the sons of Shem according to their clans and their languages, in their various territories and according to their languages.
These were the families of the sons of Noah in their various generations and clans. These divided up to become all the nations on the earth after the flood.
